{{cpp/title|strstr}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|cstring}}
{{dcl|
const char* strstr( const char* haystack, const char* needle );
}}
{{dcl|1=
Â      char* strstr(       char* haystack, const char* needle );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Finds the first occurrence of the byte string {{c|needle}} in the byte string pointed to by {{c|haystack}}. The terminating null characters are not compared.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|haystack|pointer to the null-terminated byte string to examine}}
{{par|needle|pointer to the null-terminated byte string to search for}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Pointer to the first character of the found substring in {{c|haystack}}, or a null pointer if no such character is found. If {{c|needle}} points to an empty string, {{c|haystack}} is returned.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cstring&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    const char* str = "Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.";
    const char* target = "not";

    for (const char* result = str; (result = std::strstr(result, target)); ++result)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "Found " &lt;&lt; std::quoted(target)
                  &lt;&lt; " starting at (" &lt;&lt; result - str &lt;&lt; "): "
                  &lt;&lt; std::quoted(result) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Found "not" starting at (4): "not. Do, or do not. There is no try."
Found "not" starting at (19): "not. There is no try."
}}
